ygData.subject: Two new papers dealing with Interactive Evolution in Games
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, Good to see many of you at GECCO! I m pleased to announce two new papers that make use of interactive evolution and will appear at CIG-16. In our paper

Subject: Two new papers dealing with Interactive Evolution in Games
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=360532607; y=pOhBMXr7WZe4COiEgBGvUIxMJy0J4Cn_AdISeoHTxpSHlzJyODjVJ5M
X-Yahoo-Profile: sebastian.risi
From: Sebastian Risi <sebastian.risi@...>


--047d7bfd014ee16b7205389c6e5f
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

Hi all,

Good to see many of you at GECCO! I'm pleased to announce two new
papers that make use of interactive evolution and will appear at
CIG-16.

In our paper "Artefacts: Minecraft meets Collaborative Interactive
Evolution", we introduce a new kind of game, called Artefacts, that
combines a sandbox-like environment akin to Minecraft with the ability
to interactively evolve unique three-dimensional building blocks.
While there is no explicit goal in Artefacts, the sandbox environment
together with the ability to evolve unique shapes does allow for some
interesting gameplay to emerge. See below for some example structures
that players build collaboratively.

PDF: http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/patrascu_cig16.pdf
Gameplay video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6LHYHwQGdus

In our paper "Breeding a Diversity of Super Mario Behaviors Through
Interactive Evolution", we show how casual users can create
controllers for Super Mario Bros. through an interactive evolutionary
computation approach, without prior domain or programming knowledge.
The result of a user test show that the participants are able to
evolve controllers with very diverse behaviors, which would be
difficult through automated approaches.

PDF: http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/sorensen_cig16.pdf
Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EZ3pqt0_gr4

Please let us know if you have any questions.

Best,
Sebastian

-- 
Dr. Sebastian Risi
Associate Professor
IT University of Copenhagen, Room 5D12
Rued Langgaards Vej 7, 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark
